text: statement from the BBC director-general
Tony Hall about the situation with
Jeremy Clarkson the presenter of Top
Gear the statement reads as follows it
is with great regret that I have told
Jeremy Clarkson today that the BBC will
not be renewing his contract it is not a
decision I have taken lightly I have
done so only after a very careful
consideration of the facts and after
personally meeting both Jeremy and
Bhushan
time on of course that the producer
involved in this so-called Frakker at a
hotel in Yorkshire the statement
continues I am grateful to Ken McQuarrie
for the thorough way he has conducted an
investigation of the incident on the 4th
of March given the obvious and very
genuine public interest in this
I am publishing the findings of his
report I take no pleasure in doing so
I'm only making them public so people
can better understand the background I
know how popular the programme is and I
also know that this decision will divide
opinion the main facts are not disputed
by those involved
